Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Business Processes in SAP S/4HANA
headline: This free online course will teach you how to use SAP S/4HANA to reengineer and automate your business processes.
description: This short course demonstrates how to use the SAP S/4HANA suite to reengineer your business processes for improved productivity. Learn how to deploy the app for real-time enterprise solutions for manufacturing and sales operations in your organisation. Whether you are a functional specialist, a technical consultant or a new user, taking this course will enable you to automate your business processes with SAP S/4HANA. Enrol today.

courseDescription:
Business organisations face new challenges with the increasing demand for real-time digitisation of business processes. Experts believe it may be challenging to detect process inefficiencies and effectively deploy resources for process reengineering in multifaceted organisations. Therefore, the SAP S/4HANA software suite is an ideal solution that can help improve production planning, support complex manufacturing and assembly processes and enhance quality business management. This free online course will teach you how to use SAP S/4HANA to standardise your operations, consolidate all available data and optimise your business processes.

Next, we will demonstrate the procedure for creating a business partner and how to maintain each business partner's role in the SAP Fiori app. Learn to assign a supplier to a purchasing organisation and keep the financial information data for the supplier. We will also consider the techniques for maintaining the sales and distribution data for a customer business partner role. Discover how to create a material master for a finished product using parameters like the product's category group, weight and tax classification.

The final sections of the course will present 'use case demos' for the bill of material, routing, work centre and the master data for a general ledger (G/L) account. Examine the strategies for creating material estimates and activity-type planning. Then explore how to create a sales order, a picking operation, a billing document and a purchase requisition in S/4HANA. Learn to post goods receipts, invoice receipts and outgoing payments. Finally, we will demonstrate how to create, release, confirm and close a production order in Fiori. This online course will enable you to automate management activities and reengineer your business processes with SAP S/4HANA. Start learning today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Business Process Automation in SAP S/4HANA
modules.description: In this module, we will analyze the application of the SAP S/4HANA suite in business process automation. Learn how to create and maintain business partners, material masters, bills of material, and activity price planning in Fiori. We will also explain how to create a billing document, purchase requisition, and production orders with SAP S/4HANA.
topics: Business Process Automation in SAP S/4HANA - Learning Outcome
Bill of Material and Production Cost Planning
Business Process Automation in SAP S/4HANA - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
topics: Business Processes in SAP S/4HANA - Course Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain the procedures for creating a business partner role in the SAP S/4HANA app
    • Outline the methods for creating a material master and bill of material with the Fiori app
    • Select S/4HANA apps for material cost estimation and activity price planning
    • Identify Fiori apps for creating a sales order, picking operations, and goods issue
    • Describe how to create a billing document and integrate invoices with the Fiori app
    • List the three steps for settling and closing a production order in SAP S/4HANA

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:

    1.   Create a business partner:
    1.1  To start a business partner, search for the “Maintain Business Partner” app and select it. The business partners are subdivided into various roles, and different data is maintained for each role. We also need to specify whether the business partner is a person, organization, or group.
  • 1.2  How to create a new business partner that is both a customer and a supplier:
    1.2.1  Creating a business partner—the supplier role:
    1.  Determine which group the business partner is assigned to.  2.  Choose a business partner role.
    3.  Switch from “display mode” to “change mode”.                       4. Assign the supplier to a purchasing organization.
    5.  Create a supplier's financial accounting.                                 6.  Maintain the financial accounting data.
    7.  Define a reconciliation account to which payables from the supplier will be posted.
    8.  Use the business partner as a supplier.
  • 1.2.2  Creating a business partner—the customer role:
    9.  Continue with the next role (creating a customer role).      10.   Maintain the sales and distribution data.
    11.  Choose a sales area.                                                        12.   Maintain the customer's role.
    13.  Define a reconciliation account to which receivables from the customer will be posted.
    15.  Save the customer.         16.  This means that we have maintained a business partner with all required roles.
